Authors:
Danushka Sandaruwan Tennakoon, Jayarama D. Bhat, Chang-Hsin
Kuo, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Leaf litter saprobic Dictyosporiaceae (Pleosporales,
Dothideomycetes): Pseudocoleophoma zingiberacearum sp. nov. from
Hedychium coronarium
Keywords:
1 new species  leaf litter  taxonomy  phylogeny 
Zingiberaceae
Abstract:
Leaf litter is a hidden world of activities as it provides
substrates for a variety of living things, from the smallest bacteria
and fungi, to the largest macro-invertebrates. During a survey of
taxonomic studies of leaf litter inhabiting fungi resulted in a saprobic
member of Dothideomycetes being collected from Dahu forest, Alishan
Mountain, Chiayi in Taiwan (Elevation 656 m). Morphology coupled with
combined gene analysis of a LSU, ITS and tef1-α DNA sequence data,
showed that it belongs to the family Dictyosporiaceae. A new species,
Pseudocoleophoma zingiberacearum (Zingiberaceae) from dead leaves of
Hedychium coronarium is herein described. Maximum parsimony, maximum
likelihood and Bayesian analyses were performed to clarify the
phylogenetic affinities of the species. Pseudocoleophoma zingiberacearum
is distinguished from the other Pseudocoleophoma species based on
distinct size differences in ascomata, asci, ascospores and DNA sequence
data. Interestingly, this is the first Pseudocoleophoma species record
from family Zingiberaceae. The new species is compared with other
Pseudocoleophoma species and a comprehensive description and micrographs
are provided.
